item.title: Public boolean isInBoxing
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

I see the issue.

public boolean isInBoxing(int coordX, int coordY) { if ((absX >= 3068 && absX <= 3075 && absY >= 3523 && absY <=3531)) { return true; } [b]}[/b] else { return false; }

The bolded bracket is ending the boolean, but there is an ‘else’ right after it.
Change the code to this.

public boolean isInBoxing(int coordX, int coordY) { if ((absX >= 3068 && absX <= 3075 && absY >= 3523 && absY <=3531)) { return true; } else { return false; } }

Read full topic

item.description:

ok, so here are the above and below codes from my isinboxing:

[code]
}
public boolean isinpm(long l) {
for (long element : friends) {
if (element != 0) {
if (l == element) {
return true;
}
}
}
return false;
}

public boolean isInBoxing(int coordX, int coordY) {
	if ((absX >= 3068 && absX <= 3075 && absY >= 3523 && absY <=3531)) {
		return true;
	}
	} else {
		return false;		
}

public boolean isInWilderness(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) {
	if (Type == 1) {
		if ((coordY >= 3523) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392))
				if ((blahblahblahdsgrfhy) {
			return true;
		}
	} else if (Type == 2) {
		if ((coordY >= 3512) && (coordY <= 3967) && (coordX <= 3392)
				&& (coordX >= 2942)) {
			return true;
		}
	}
	return false;
}[/code]

item.title: Public boolean isInBoxing
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

hey, I am making a boxing area, and this is my code:

	public boolean isInBoxing(int coordX, int coordY) {
		if ((absX >= 3068 && absX <= 3075 && absY >= 3523 && absY <=3531)) {
			return true;
		} else {
			return false;		
	}

can anyone fix my mistakes? cuz i get 100 errors when I put it above isInWilderness(the one with a bunch of coords)
oh, and if this helps, here are my boxing box coords:

3068 3523 - southwest area 3068 3531 - northwest area 3075 3531 - northeast area 3075 3523 - southeast area
so compare those with this line:

absX >= 3068 && absX <= 3075 && absY >= 3523 && absY <=3531
because i dont wanna screw that up aswell
all help is appreciated

  • Usman555

Read full topic
